documents.text: Patient admitted with high fever and cough. Diagnosed with pneumonia. Started IV antibiotics.
Ceftriaxone 1g IV every 12 hours for 5 days. Paracetamol 500mg as needed for fever.
WBC: 13,000/mmÂ³ (elevated), CRP: 45 mg/L. Chest X-ray shows infiltrates in right lower lobe.
Patient responding well to antibiotics. Temperature normal for last 24 hours.
Diagnosed pneumonia, treated with antibiotics, patient stable and discharged with oral medication for 3 days.
Patient admitted with chest pain. ECG shows mild abnormality, troponin levels normal.
Cholesterol 220 mg/dL, Triglycerides 180 mg/dL, normal liver and kidney function tests.
Diagnosed with non-cardiac chest pain, advised diet modification and medication.
